intro: Spermacoce brachystema subvar. chillagoensis, commonly known as the narrowstembed mouseear, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
